page.title: List of professional sports teams in California

revisions.rev:
{{Merge from|Professional sports teams based in California (past and present)|date=September 2009}} {{update|date=January 2010}} The following is a '''list of professional [[sport]]s teams in [[California]]''' as of 2008. ==Major Professional Sports Teams== ===Major League Baseball=== ====Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim==== :''based in [[Anaheim, California|Anaheim]], California'' '' ([[Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1961 ::*Previously known as the Los Angeles Angels (1961-1965), California Angels (1965-1996), and Anaheim Angels (1997-2004) ::*Currently play at [[Angel Stadium of Anaheim]] (1966-present) ::*Previously played at [[Wrigley Field (Los Angeles)|Wrigley Field]] (1961) and [[Dodger Stadium|ChÃ¡vez Ravine Stadium]] (1961-1965) ::*World Championships1: [[2002 World Series|2002]] ====Los Angeles Dodgers==== :''based in [[Los Angeles]], California'' ''([[Los Angeles Dodgers|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[Brooklyn, New York|Brooklyn]] in 1958 ::*Previously known as the Brooklyn Dodgers (1932-1957) and [[Los Angeles Dodgers#Team history|others]] (1883-1931) ::*Currently play at [[Dodger Stadium]] (1962-present) ::*Previously played at [[Ebbets Field]] (1913-1957), [[Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum]] (1958-1961), and [[Los Angeles Dodgers#Team history|others]] (1883-1912) ::*World Championships1: [[1959 World Series|1959]], [[1963 World Series|1963]], [[1965 World Series|1965]], [[1981 World Series|1981]], [[1988 World Series|1988]] ====Oakland Athletics==== :''based in [[Oakland]], California'' ''([[Oakland Athletics|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]] in 1968 ::*Previously known as the Philadelphia Athletics (1901-1954) and Kansas City Athletics (1955-1967) ::*Currently play at the [[Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum]] (1968-present) ::*Previously played at [[Columbia Park]] (1901-1908), [[Shibe Park]] (1909-1954), and [[Municipal Stadium (Kansas City)|Municipal Stadium]] (1955-1967) ::*World Championships1: [[1972 World Series|1972]], [[1973 World Series|1973]], [[1974 World Series|1974]], [[1989 World Series|1989]] ====San Diego Padres==== :''based in [[San Diego]], California'' ''([[San Diego Padres|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1969 ::*No previous [[moniker]]s ::*Currently play at [[Petco Park|PETCO Park]] (2004-present) ::*Previously played at [[Qualcomm Stadium]] (1969-2003) ::*World Championships: None ====San Francisco Giants==== :''based in [[San Francisco]], California'' ''([[San Francisco Giants|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[New York City|New York]] in 1958 ::*Previously known as the New York Gothams (1883-1885) and New York Giants (1885 -1958) ::*Currently play at [[AT&T Park]] (2000-present) ::*Previously played at [[Polo Grounds]] (1911-1957), [[Seals Stadium]] (1958-1959), [[Candlestick Park]] (1960-1999), and [[San Francisco Giants#New York Giants history|others]] (1883-1910) ::*World Championships1: 2010
12235 1 World Championships won while playing in California ===National Football League=== ====Oakland Raiders==== :''based in [[Oakland]], California'' ''([[Oakland Raiders|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1960, played in [[Los Angeles]] from 1982-1994 ::*Previously known as the Los Angeles Raiders (1982-1994) ::*Currently play at the [[Oakland-Alameda County Coliseum]] (1966-1981, 1994-present) ::*Previously played at [[Kezar Stadium]] (1960), [[Candlestick Park]] (1960-1961), [[Frank Youell Field]] (1962-1965), and [[Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum]] (1982-1994) ::*World Championships: 1976 ([[Super Bowl XI|XI]]), 1980 ([[Super Bowl XV|XV]]), 1983 ([[Super Bowl XVIII|XVIII]]) ====San Diego Chargers==== :''based in [[San Diego]], California'' ''([[San Diego Chargers|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1960, played in [[Los Angeles]] in 1960 ::*Previously known as the Los Angeles Chargers (1960) ::*Currently play at [[Qualcomm Stadium]] (1967-present) ::*Previously played at [[Los Angeles Memorial Coliseum]] (1960) and [[Balboa Stadium]] (1961-1966) ::*World Championships: None ====San Francisco 49ers==== :''based in [[downtown]], California'' ''([[San Francisco 49ers|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1946 ([[All-America Football Conference|AAFC]]), joined [[NFL]] in 1950 ::*No previous [[moniker]]s ::*Currently play at [[Candlestick Park]] (1971-present) ::*Previously played at [[Kezar Stadium]] (1946-1970) ::*World Championships1: 1981 ([[Super Bowl XVI|XVI]]), 1984 ([[Super Bowl XIX|XIX]]), 1988 ([[Super Bowl XXIII|XXIII]]), 1989 ([[Super Bowl XXIV|XXIV]]), 1994 ([[Super Bowl XXIX|XXIX]]) ===National Basketball Association=== ====Golden State Warriors==== :''based in [[Oakland]], California'' ''([[Golden State Warriors|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[Philadelphia]] in 1962 ::*Previously known as the Philadelphia Warriors (1946-1962) and San Francisco Warriors (1962-1971) ::*Currently play at the [[Oracle Arena]] (1966â1967, 1971â1996 and 1997âpresent) ::*Previously played at [[Cow Palace]] (1962â64, 1966â71), [[San Francisco Civic Auditorium]] (1964â67), USF [[War Memorial Gymnasium]] (1964â66), [[HP Pavilion at San Jose]] (1996-1997), and [[Golden State Warriors#Home arenas|others]] (1946-1962) ::*World Championships1: [[1975 NBA Finals|1975]] ====Los Angeles Clippers==== :''based in [[Los Angeles]], California'' ''([[Los Angeles Clippers|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo]] in 1978, relocated to [[Los Angeles]] in 1984 ::*Previously known as the Buffalo Braves (1970-1978) and San Diego Clippers (1978-1984) ::*Currently play at [[Staples Center]] (1999-present) ::*Previously played at [[Buffalo Memorial Auditorium]] (1970-1978), [[San Diego Sports Arena]] (1978-1984), [[Los Angeles Memorial Sports Arena]] (1984-1999), and [[Honda Center|Arrowhead Pond]] (1994-1999) ::*World Championships: None ====Los Angeles Lakers==== :''based in [[Los Angeles]], California'' ''([[Los Angeles Lakers|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[Minneapolis]] in 1960 ::*Previously known as the Detroit Gems (1946-1947) and Minneapolis Lakers (1947-1960) ::*Currently play at [[Staples Center]] (1999-present) ::*Previously played at [[Minneapolis Auditorium]] (1947-1960), [[Los Angeles Memorial Sports Arena]] (1960-1967), [[The Forum (Inglewood, California)|The Forum]] (1967-1999) ::*World Championships1: [[1972 NBA Finals|1972]], [[1980 NBA Finals|1980]], [[1982 NBA Finals|1982]], [[1985 NBA Finals|1985]], [[1987 NBA Finals|1987]], [[1988 NBA Finals|1988]], [[2000 NBA Finals|2000]], [[2001 NBA Finals|2001]], [[2002 NBA Finals|2002]], [[2009 NBA Finals|2009]], [[2010 NBA Finals|2010]] ====Sacramento Kings==== :''based in [[Sacramento, California|Sacramento]], California'' ''([[Sacramento Kings|Main Article]])'' ::*Relocated from [[Kansas City, Missouri|Kansas City]] in 1985 ::*Previously known as the Rochester Royals (1945-1957), Cincinnati Royals(1957-1972), Kansas City-Omaha Kings (1972-1975), Kansas City Kings (1975-1985) ::*Currently play at [[ARCO Arena]] (1988-present) ::*Previously played at [[Kansas City Municipal Auditorium]] (1972-1974) [[Omaha Civic Auditorium]] (1972-1978), [[Kemper Arena]] (1974-1985), [[ARCO Arena (First)|ARCO Arena I]] (1985-1988), and [[Sacramento Kings#Home arenas|others]] (1945-1972) ::*World Championships1: None
1 World Championships won while playing in California ===National Hockey League=== ====Anaheim Ducks==== :''based in [[Anaheim, California|Anaheim]], California'' ''([[Anaheim Ducks|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1993 ::*Previously known as the Mighty Ducks of Anaheim (1993-2006) ::*Currently play at [[Honda Center]] (1993-present) ::*No Previous Arenas ''(Honda Center was formerly known as Arrowhead Pond of Anaheim)'' ::*World Championships: [[2007 Stanley Cup Finals|2007]] ====Los Angeles Kings==== :''based in [[Los Angeles]], California'' ''([[Los Angeles Kings|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1967 ::*No previous [[moniker]]s ::*Currently play at [[Staples Center]] (1999-present) ::*Previously played at [[Long Beach Arena]] (1967), [[Los Angeles Memorial Sports Arena]] (1967), [[The Forum (Inglewood, California)|The Forum]] (1967-1999) ::*World Championships: None ====San Jose Sharks==== :''based in [[San Jose, California|San Jose]], California'' ''([[San Jose Sharks|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 1991 ::*No previous [[moniker]]s ::*Currently play at [[HP Pavilion at San Jose]] (1991-present) ::*Previously played at [[Cow Palace]] (1991-1993) ::*World Championships: None ===Major League Soccer=== ====Los Angeles Galaxy==== :''based in [[Carson, California|Carson]], California'' ''([[Los Angeles Galaxy|Main Article]])'' ::*Original team in league's 1996 inaugural season ::*No previous [[moniker]]s ::*Currently play at [[Home Depot Center]] (2003-present) ::*Previously played at [[Rose Bowl (stadium)|Rose Bowl]] (1996-2002) ::*Championships: [[MLS Cup]] (2002, 2005), [[MLS Supporters' Shield|Supporters' Shield]] (1998, 2002, 2010, 2011), [[Lamar Hunt U.S. Open Cup]] (2001, 2005), [[CONCACAF Champions Cup]] (2000) ====Chivas USA==== :''based in [[Carson, California|Carson]], California'' ''([[C.D. Chivas USA|Main Article]])'' ::*Expansion team in 2004 ::*No previous [[moniker]]s ::*Currently play at [[Home Depot Center]] (2003-present) ::*No Previous Arenas ::*Championships: None ====San Jose Earthquakes==== :''based in [[Santa Clara, California|Santa Clara]], California'' ''([[San Jose Earthquakes|Main Article]])'' ::*Original team in league's 1996 inaugural season ::*Previously known as the San Jose Clash (1996-1999) ::*Currently play at [[Buck Shaw Stadium]] (2008-present) ::*Previously played at [[Spartan Stadium (San Jose)|Spartan Stadium]] (1996-2005) ::*Championships: [[MLS Cup]] (2001, 2003), [[MLS Supporters' Shield|Supporters' Shield]] (2005) ==Other Professional Sports Franchises== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:85%;" !style="background: #e3e3e3;"
